qas.question: What is another predominant religion of Zhejiang besides Chinese folk religions and Taoist traditions?
According to surveys in 2007 and 2009, what percent of the population believes in cults of ancestors?
According to surveys in 2007 and 2009, what percent of the population identifies as Christian?
What percent of the population identified as Christians in 2004?
What percent of the population may be irreligious?
What is another predominant religion of Zhejiang besides Japanese folk religions and Taoist traditions?
According to surveys in 2007 and 2009, what percent of the population does not believe in cults of ancestors?
What percent of the population identified as Christians in 2007?
What percent of the population is not irreligious?

context: The predominant religions in Zhejiang are Chinese folk religions, Taoist traditions and <a0_0>Chinese <b5_0>Buddhism<b5_0/><a0_0/>. According to surveys conducted in 2007 and 2009, <a1_0><b6_0>23.02%<b6_0/><a1_0/> of the population believes and is involved in cults of ancestors, while <a2_0>2.62%<a2_0/> of the population identifies as Christian, decreasing from <a3_0><b7_0>3.92%<b7_0/><a3_0/> in 2004. The reports didn't give figures for other types of religion; <a4_0><b8_0>74.36%<b8_0/><a4_0/> of the population may be either irreligious or involved in worship of nature deities, Buddhism, Confucianism, Taoism, folk religious sects, and small minorities of Muslims.
